title: Business Live: US shares bounce - BBC News
summary: stock markets gyrate on inflation news .
sky shares above fox offer price .
persimmon boss to set up charitable trust .

documents.title: good night
text: that 's it for wednesday on business live .
we 'll be back bright and early at 06:00 tomorrow .
do join us then for all the latest breaking news and analysis from the business world .

documents.title: labour 's pet promise
text: labour wants to strengthen the rights of tenants to keep a pet in their properties as part of a package of proposed animal welfare measures .
some rental agreements drawn up by landlords insist on no animals .
tenants can seek permission to keep pets but labour wants a default right for them to do so unless there is evidence their pet will be a nuisance .

documents.title: wall street closes up
text: wall street shares closed up on wednesday , as the market shrugged off us inflation data and tech shares rose .
the dow jones rose 1.03 % to 24,893 points .
the s & p 500 climbed 1.34 % to 2,699 .
and the tech-heavy nasdaq was up 1.86 % to 7,144 .

documents.title: would you share your dna to find love ?
text: this valentine 's day , your smell could hold the key to your romantic future .
one online dating app uses your dna and pheromones to match you with a partner - but how reliable is it ?
this valentine 's day , your smell could hold the key to your romantic future .
one online dating app uses your dna and pheromones to match you with a partner - but how reliable is it ?
congrats , y'all !

documents.title: why being fired is n't always a bad thing
text: you 'd think that being fired from your job is never a good thing , but it can be a way to `` make it big '' in the oil industry - if you 're high up in the pecking order .
just ask james bennett , the chief executive of sandridge energy , who was dismissed last week with a severance package worth at least $ 14m , according to bloomberg .
that figure is n't even the most the firm has ever awarded .
when sandridge energy 's founder tom ward was pushed out of the company in 2013 due to investor unrest , he received a $ 90m severance .

documents.title: tesla 's chinese dream is n't going so well
text: elon musk is failing to move forward with getting tesla cars sold in the world 's biggest electric vehicle market , due to a legislative hitch .
under chinese law , all foreign carmakers must partner with chinese companies if they want to open a factory to manufacture in the country .
however , tesla wants to own the factory completely , and so after over seven months ' of negotiations , tesla and the shanghai government have failed to come to an agreement , reports bloomberg .

documents.title: apple 's homepod speakers leave white marks on wood
text: apple 's new smart speakers can discolour wooden surfaces , leaving a white mark where they are placed , the firm has acknowledged .
the us company has suggested that owners may have to re-oil furniture if the homepod is moved .
the device went on sale last week after having been delayed from its original 2017 release date .
apple told pocket-lint that it was `` not unusual '' for speakers with silicone bases to leave a `` mild mark '' .

documents.title: fda approves johnson & johnson cancer treatment
text: the us food and drug administration has approved johnson & johnson 's erleada treatment for use with prostate cancer patients whose cancer has not spread but continues to grow despite hormone therapy .
the drug is the first fda-approved treatment for non-metastatic , castration-resistant prostate cancer .

documents.title: groupon shares fall
text: groupon 's shares have fallen on the news that the discount deals website failed to meet profit expectations for the first time in two years .
shares in groupon fell 11.54 % or 0.6 points to $ 4.60 after reporting fourth quarter net income of $ 47.7m , a loss compared to the same period in the previous year .

documents.title: rising trade tensions
text: the us commerce department says chinese manufacturers of cast iron soil pipe fittings have dumped products in the us below cost , a preliminary decision that could lead to tariffs .
the us will start collecting duties on imports based on the initial determination .
a final decision is expected later this year .
the decision comes amid rising trade tensions between the us and china .
the investigation of the pipe fittings was triggered by petitions from us companies .
the us government has also initiated some broader chinese trade investigations , including into intellectual property practices .

documents.title: ai does grunt work
text: artificial intelligence technology has been developed to help piglets survive their first months - and then to decide which sows to kill .
the scheme is being rolled out in china , the world 's biggest producer and consumer of pork .
it marks the latest deployment of tech giant alibaba 's et brain cloud computing service .

documents.title: the business of romance
text: romantic novels are big business , and in the us alone , more than $ 1bn of them are sold each year .
joanne grant , editorial director of the harlequin series - known as mills and boon in britain - tells bbc world news why romance novels never seem to go out of style .
$ 1bn+ of # romantic novels are sold in the usa every year .
this # valentinesday @ twitterid has been telling @ twitterid how @ twitterid keeps attracting new readers around the world # valentines2018 # books
i love the line about authors living next door to you .
i live in a small close of just 6 houses .
not one of my neighbours has ever asked what i do .
glad your books there lovely , wo n't be reading any dare books if they 're going with the fifty shades of grooming or how to abuse , il stick to authors i adore already like you dear lady xxx
they 're not abusive or lik 50 shades .
just a hotter heat level .
but delighted you adore my books
i just keep hearing dare books are like fifty shades puts me right off even trying them lol xxx love ya xxx

the good old days ! !
plenty of romance between same sex couples too nowadays .
and also in the past too .
we walk amongst you !
i love that all pairings are now in the romances love is love it does n't choose gender xxxxx
jo !
throwing kisses toward the uk .
@ twitterid is lovely !
great piece .
author: BBC World

documents.title: london closes on a high
text: london shares closed on a high on wednesday , helped by engineering giant gkn , which revealed plans to sell parts of its business to prevent a possible takeover from turnaround specialist melrose .
the ftse 100 closed up 45.96 points or 0.64 % at 7,213.97 , led by gold mining business randgold resources , rising 4.8 % to £ 63.86 .
the ftse 250 meanwhile saw a 128.3 points or 0.66 % rise to 19,448.38 .
provident financial topped the index , climbing 8.5 % to 714.2p after cutting ties with rugby league team bradford bulls .

documents.title: flying cars might be getting closer to reality
text: why we need to start taking flying cars seriously again # thedisruptors

documents.title: bgis wins carillion contracts
text: canadian firm bgis has been awarded a large number of hospital , education , justice , transport and emergency services contracts from collapsed construction giant carillion .
it is not known how much the deal is worth , but it will see bgis take on over 2,500 carillion employees .
`` this deal provides continuity of services for a large number of customers providing critical infrastructure within the uk market , '' said bgis chief executive gord hicks .
`` our team is looking forward to engaging both customers and employees in the days ahead to effect the transaction and ensure a smooth transition . ''

documents.title: is the uk now a 'touch ' ahead ?
text: the wall street journal 's mike bird tweets about british gdp and how it relates to the us
i 'm sure lots of people have said this already , but i wonder if the best way to look at post-eu ref economic situation in the uk is that the business cycle just got shoved ahead .
we were seemingly a touch behind us cycle .
now a touch ahead into the more negative bits .
e.g .
that we skipped out some of the goldilocks recovery period , swapped for more sustained ( not £ related ) inflation , shallow interest rate hikes .
it 's not good go back
and it 's a hell on earth hots , have you not heard

documents.title: oxfam direct debit donations fall
text: more than 1,000 people cancelled their regular donations to oxfam over the weekend as more claims about a sexual misconduct scandal emerged .
oxfam confirmed that 1,270 direct debit payments were stopped across saturday , sunday and monday .
the number is far above the average cancellation rate of 600 per month .
the charity is at the centre of allegations that staff working for oxfam in haiti and other countries paid vulnerable people for sex .

documents.title: jp morgan lowers us economic growth estimate
text: jp morgan says it has lowered its outlook on us economic growth in the first quarter from 3 % to 2.5 % due to `` ugly '' data on domestic retail sales in january offsetting a `` scorching '' consumer price report .
`` today 's inflation reading should probably cement in place the fed 's intent to hike rates at the march fomc meeting , '' jp morgan economist michael feroli wrote in a research note .
`` we now also think the odds are moving up that they also revise their guidance at that meeting from looking for three hikes this year to four , aligning with our view . ''

documents.title: search tool lets users access files in aws servers
text: a website created by anonymous hackers has been launched that allows anyone to search for sensitive data stored in the cloud .
buckhacker is a tool that trawls servers at amazon web services ( aws ) , a popular cloud computing platform .
aws provides data storage to private firms , governments and universities , among others .
exposed data has been found on it before , but buckhacker makes searching for it much easier .

documents.title: could it be a blip ?
text: thomas gift , a lecturer of political science at ucl , tells bbc world service why he thinks the latest cpi data could just be a blip
us # inflation was higher than expected in january , 2.1 % on the cpi measure , but it could well be just a blip dr thomas gift of @ twitterid tells @ twitterid # economics
so enjoyed this guest ! ! !
dr .
gift was articulate and made the subject easy to understand hope to see him on again soon !
aaron- you two seem to talk very naturally together : ) great questions , great answers !
author: BBC World Service

documents.title: wall street on the move
text: us shares have now pulled back up - the dow jones has risen 57.5 points or 0.23 % to 24,697.95 .
the s & p 500 is up 11.67 points or 0.44 % to 2,674.75
and the tech-heavy nasdaq has climbed 0.8 % or 56.2 points to 7,069.70 .

documents.title: increased volatility ahead
text: craig inches , head of short rates and cash at royal london asset management believes that there will likely be higher volatility in light of the higher-than-expected inflation .

while the next psychological barrier for 10 year treasury yields of 3 % is still a little way off , this latest data is likely to reignite the diet of increased volatility currently feeding both bond and equity markets , although fixed income assets should weather this better , '' he said .
`` we 're maintaining a shorter duration bias across our government bond funds , to better protect against the impact of rising bond yields . ''

documents.title: 'china 's google ' plans ipo for its version of netflix
text: chinese search giant baidu says it is planning a us stock market listing of its online video-streaming unit , iqiyi .
the company is expecting to try and raise about $ 1bn - but baidu will still keep control of the venture .
along with alibaba and tencent , baidu is one of china 's big three tech firms .
news of the ipo plan came as it announced fourth quarter revenue of 23.6 billion yuan ( £ 2.6bn ; $ 3.6bn ) in the last three months of 2017 - beating forecasts .
iqiyi has been likened to netflix , and the us firm last year struck a deal to licence content to its chinese equivalent .
author: Simon Atkinson
Asia Business Reporter

documents.title: wall street down on open
text: us shares fell on open on wednesday , following news that consumer prices rose more than expected to 0.5 % , while annual inflation remained at 2.1 % , when it had been estimated to fall .
the dow jones has slipped 58.9 points or 0.24 % to 24,581.59 .
the losers are led by microsoft , falling 1.4 % to $ 88.57 .

the technology giant has been awarded over a quarter of a million dollars in damages by a san francisco court , which found that canadian developer corel 's software did copy some of the user interfaces in microsoft office .
the s & p 500 is down 13.1 points or 0.49 % to 2,649.84 .
healthcare real estate investors hcp inc leads the losers , after reporting a drop in earnings for the fourth quarter compared the same period in the year before .
and the tech-heavy nasdaq has dropped 15.1 points or 0.22 % to 6,998.43 .
shares in zion oil and gas , which doubled on tuesday after news the firm struck oil in israel , are now down 17 % to $ 3.57 .

documents.title: metallica win top music prize
text: heavy metal pioneers metallica are being honoured with sweden 's polar prize , one of the most prestigious awards in music .
the band , best known for 1991 's black album , redefined the sound of metal with a tougher , faster and more abrasive take on rock .
polar prize organisers said the us band could transform `` a teenage bedroom into a valhalla '' .
metallica will receive their £ 90,000 prize in stockholm this june .
they 're the first metal band to win the award , which has previously gone to the likes of paul mccartney , joni mitchell , chuck berry and bb king .
more here .

documents.title: good afternoon
text: thanks to chris and simon for this morning 's live coverage of all things business , and a happy valentine 's day to all who celebrate it .
mary-ann russon with you until 21:30 for the rest of the day 's news and views from britain and beyond .
got a point of view ?
tweet me at @ twitterid and @ twitterid

documents.title: shire shares slide
text: shares in pharmaceutical firm shire slid 1.2 % after it said 2018 sales would grow in mid-single digits and profits would rise at an even slower pace .
the london-listed firm , which is splitting its rare disease and hyperactivity drugs into two units , reported full-year revenue today of $ 15.16bn ( £ 10.97bn ) up 33 % .

nicholas hyett , equity analyst at hargreaves lansdown , commented : `` it 's never possible to know exactly how things are going to pan out in big pharma , since all the billions spent on r & d could end up producing little of value .
but we feel shire has done a lot of the hard graft to ensure it 's in the right position for where it is in the cycle . ''

documents.title: us annual inflation at 2.1 % 'a surprise '
text: annual us inflation remained at 2.1 % , but was `` a surprise compared to consensus estimates of 1.9 % , '' said mitul patel , head of interest rates at janus henderson .
`` the treasury market sold off in response , led by shorter dated bonds .
inflation expectations moved higher , whilst equity markets were softer , '' patel added .
`` although the cpi print was higher than expected , risks remain in both direction for the coming year . ''

documents.title: dollar skips higher after inflation data
text: the us dollar added about a third of a euro cent after that stronger than expected inflation data was released .
it had been trading at €0.81 but jumped to €0.814 .
the labor department said its consumer price index increased 0.5 % last month .
`` this is a strong number , '' said aberdeen standard investments investment strategist luke bartholomew .
the fed is now very likely to follow through on its plan to raise rates again in march .
`` if the sell-off gathers real momentum then they will need to think about their plans again but we 're a long way from there . ''

documents.title: breakingus inflation higher than expected at 0.5 %
text: us consumer prices rose more than expected in january .
the labor department said its consumer price index increased 0.5 % last month as households paid more for gasoline , rental accommodation and healthcare .
the cpi rose 0.2 % in december .

documents.title: another atm blown up by raiders
text: in darlington this morning crooks blew up a cash machine to steal the money contained inside .
it was the second-such raid to hit the town : four months ago an atm outside matalan was obliterated .
the latest incident happened at 1.40am today outside a heron foods store .
police believe the suspects filled the free-standing machine with gas and ignited it to cause an explosion .

documents.title: market update
text: the ftse 100 is still positive , up 0.75 % at 7,222 points , with coca-cola hbc the biggest riser - up more than 6 % .
tui is the biggest faller , shedding lost to 4 % .
sterling , meanwhile , is down 0.25 % at $ 1.3858 .

documents.title: 800 jobs saved in leeds
text: edinburgh woollen mill has snapped up the leeds-based tailoring firm berwin & berwin from administrators frp advisory .
the acquisition includes its three brands paul costelloe , lambretta and baumler , 36 menswear concessions and outlets , and all existing stock and will secure the jobs of 800 workers .
a spokesman for edinburgh woolen mill group said : across the group , we have always committed ourselves to saving jobs where we can and in the case of berwin & berwin no jobs will be lost . ''

documents.title: uber cuts losses
text: uber narrowed its fourth-quarter loss to $ 1.1bn , down from $ 1.46bn in the previous quarter , according to a source quoted by reuters .
revenues jumped 11.8 % to $ 2.22bn ( £ 1.6bn ) in the last three months of 2017 compared with the same period the previous year , while the total value of fares rose to $ 11bn .
it was the first full quarter under dara khosrowshahi , who took over the troubled firm as chief executive in september .

documents.title: more used motors change hands
text: the south-east is still driving the second hand car market , according to the society of motor manufacturers and traders .
it says just over eight million used motors changed hands last year - the second-highest number on record after 2016 's total .
some 1.2 million used car transactions took place in the south east .
ford and vauxhall super-minis remain the most popular used cars with demand growing by 9.5 % .
however demand for alternatively-fuelled vehicles climbed 21 % , with zero emission used car sales up 77 % - passing 10,000 for the first time .

documents.title: netflix nabs glee creator
text: netflix has struck a five-year , $ 300m deal with ryan murphy , the brains behind hit shows including american horror story , glee and nip/tuck
he will move over to the streaming giant when his deal with fox expires at the end of june .
ryan murphy 's series have influenced the global cultural zeitgeist , reinvented genres and changed the course of television history , '' said ted sarandos , chief content officer at netflix .
the hollywood reporter notes that netflix now has murphy on board along with grey 's anatomy creator shonda rhimes and orange is the new black 's jenji kohan in a bid to own more of its content .

text: the foreign secretary used a slightly surprising turn of phrase in his speech , which has just ended .
boris johnson says he 's always been `` loving and caring '' in his language in the # brexit debate

documents.title: no details
text: financial times uk news editor malcolm moore is none too impressed with boris 's speech :
no details and tone all over the place .
boris johnson is a pretty poor speaker .
so obviously written for him - which , for him is unusual

text: boris johnson is delivering his brexit speech in london and bbc economics editor kamal ahmed is listening so you do n't have to .
foreign sec @ twitterid says economic benefits of eu are `` not as irrefutable '' as argued .
`` taking back control '' will allow firms to innovate outside eu regs which have `` specific aim to hold back uk competitors ''

documents.title: has sky 's price tag risen ?
text: george salmon , equity analyst at hargreaves lansdown , says sky is the big winner from the premier league rights auction .
`` securing more games at a lower cost is a major coup , and with bt seemingly content to play second fiddle on the premier league , that rivalry now looks to have thawed , '' he comments .

`` there 's always the chance the remaining two packages spring a surprise , but with reserve prices not yet reached , it 's safe to say amazon , netflix and other potential new entrants are n't prepared to adopt the aggressive strategy sky execs must have feared .
`` all this means sky looks much healthier than when rupert murdoch 's 21st century fox first bid for the business .
in early trading the shares touched £ 10.95 , 20p ahead of the price fox has agreed to pay .
this tells us murdoch might need to come back with an improved offer . ''

documents.title: asian markets bounce back
text: after the huge sell-offs of last week it has been another positive day on many asian indexes .
at the close of trade on wednesday , hong kong 's hang seng index was up 676 points , or 2.3 % , at 30,515 and the shanghai composite closed up 0.5 % at 3,199.5 points .
however in japan , the nikkei 225 - which swayed between positive and negative territory throughout the day - ended down 0.4 % at 21,154 points - its lowest closing level mid-october last year .

documents.title: online gambling firm fined £ 350,000 for misleading 'free bonus ' ad
text: online gambling business electraworks has been fined £ 350,000 by the gambling commission for repeatedly misleading consumers with adverts relating to free bonuses .
the advertising standards authority upheld a complaint against electraworks - a gibraltar-based business owned by gvc - in 2016 about an advert offering a free bonus on its bwin.com website .
gambling commission codes restrict ads which relate to 'free bet ' , 'bonus ' or similar offers .
the gambling commission discovered another advert breaching the code in 2016 , and six more in 2017 .

richard watson , commission programme director , said : this fine should serve a warning to all gambling businesses that we will not hesitate to take action against those who mislead consumers with bonus offers . ''

documents.title: bank braces for wage rises
text: british businesses plan to offer staff bigger pay rises this year due to a higher minimum wage and staff shortages , according to a bank of england survey that is likely to feed the central bank 's concern about growing domestic inflation pressures .

firms plan to offer average pay settlements of 3.1 % compared with 2.6 % last year , the bank said , with the biggest increases in consumer services businesses with a high number of staff paid close to the minimum wage .
`` companies also reported an increased tendency to pay above the national living wage , due to competitive pressures .
however , many firms were planning to limit management pay increases to 1-2 % in order to hold down their overall pay settlement , '' the bank said .
the survey was based on replies from 368 businesses employing 845,000 staff in britain .

documents.title: crackdown on gambling ads
text: the committees of advertising practice ( cap ) has announced tougher standards on gambling advertising .
the new rules will come into affect on 2 april and will restrict ads that create an inappropriate sense of urgency like those including bet now ! ''
offers during live events .

they also aim to curb trivialisation of gambling , such as encouraging repetitive play , and prevent approaches that give an irresponsible perception of the risk or control ( such as `` risk free deposit bonus '' ) .

shahriar coupal , director of the committees of advertising practice , said : we wo n't tolerate gambling ads that exploit people 's vulnerabilities or play fast and loose with eye-catching free bet and bonus offers . ''

documents.title: euro gdp growth up 2.5 % in 2017
text: euro gdp climbed 0.6 % in the fourth quarter , according to a flash estimate published by eurostat , the statistical office of the european union .
the third-quarter growth figure was 0.7 % .
compared with the same quarter of 2016 , seasonally-adjusted gdp rose by 2.7 % in the euro area and by 2.6 % in the eu28 .
over the whole year 2017 , gdp grew by 2.5 % in both zones .

documents.title: pound falls on johnson fears
text: sterling has slipped to a five-week low against the euro today at €1.1228 .
boris johnson is the reason .
investors are worried about the foreign secretary 's pro-brexit speech today .
johnson will say that leaving the eu `` is not grounds for fear but hope '' .
but analysts are concerned .
`` last time he gave a major speech , sterling sold off by 0.8 percent , '' said ing currency strategist viraj patel .
`` the risk is that he comes out and muddies the situation a bit more . ''

documents.title: breakingpersimmon boss bows to pressure
text: the boss of persimmon has bowed to pressure over the millions in bonuses he is set to reap and says he will set up a charitable trust .
jeff fairburn has faced intense criticism over an incentive plan that could see him receive share options worth more than £ 100m .

`` i recognise and profoundly regret that persimmon 's strong performance over the last few years is being eclipsed by the controversy surrounding the 2012 ltip ( long-term incentive plan ) award , '' he said on wednesday .
`` i am setting up a private charitable trust which i plan to use to benefit wider society over a sustained period of time by supporting , in a very meaningful way , my chosen charities . ''

documents.title: h & m eyes online expansion
text: fast fashion chain h & m says like-for-like store sales are set to continue falling over a `` challenging '' year ahead .
but the swedish retailer hopes for a `` somewhat better result '' than 2017 on the back of growth of at least 25 % in online sales and new brands such as cos and h & m home .
the company is holding its first capital markets day for analysts and investors in stockholm today .

documents.title: plus500 predicts `` significant '' revenue
text: financial spreadbetter plus500 says its 2018 revenue will be `` significantly '' ahead of market expectations .
its net profit for 2017 climbed 70 % to £ 199.7m on the back of increased new customers and active customers .
but that was all handed back to shareholders in the form of dividends and a share buyback programme .
the company - which sponsors atletico madrid - provides an online trading platform for retail customers to trade contracts for differences .
asaf elimelech , chief executive , predicted : `` the industry will consolidate around a smaller number of larger participants . ''

documents.title: war of words as melrose reacts to gkn plans
text: melrose has described gkn 's plans to fend off its hostile bid as `` long on adjectives and promises but desperately short on detail '' .

the company 's spokeswoman said gkn 's promise to return £ 2.5bn to shareholders was a `` stark admission of management failure combined with a series of promises which fall well short of what melrose is proposing '' .

the company said it would keep powder metallurgy `` for further improvement and use our proven skills to transform the core businesses of gkn while delivering growth and shareholder return at the fast-growing nortek . ''

documents.title: danone to sell yakult stake
text: french yoghurt-maker danone said this morning it will sell a 14 % stake in japan 's probiotics maker yakult to raise around €1.5bn ( £ 1.34bn ) .
the company has been under investor pressure to boost returns in the face of sluggish demand and private label competition .
the sale will still leave it with a 7 % stake in the japanese firm .
last year , danone sold dairy business stonyfield to lactalis for $ 875m ( £ 630m ) after snapping up us organic foods firm whitewave for $ 12.5bn ( £ 9bn ) .

documents.title: galliford sinks
text: galliford try 's £ 150m fundraising has n't gone down too well with investors this morning - shares are down almost 19 %
analysts at liberum remain optimistic , however :
we see more upside in galliford try than in any other of the housebuilders .
the capital raise is unexpected , but should be supported as it will eliminate any perception of financial weakness .
the group 's balance sheet will be strong after the raise , which although uncertain in timing has been fully underwritten . ''

documents.title: german economy keeps growing
text: the german economy continued to be positive at the end of last year , growing by 0.6 % in the three months to the end of december on the back of strong exports .
figures released by the federal statistics office showed a slight slowdown from the 0.7 % growth posted in the third quarter .
full year gdp growth was 2.2 % , which translates into a calendar-adjusted rate of 2.5 % , the strongest growth rate since 2011 .

documents.title: serco pays less for carillion
text: outsourcing giant serco has slashed the price it will pay for a large slice of failed rival carillion 's healthcare division by almost £ 20m .
serco said the price has been revised from the £ 47.7m agreed when the deal was announced in december to £ 29.7m .

the revised price reflects the fact that the healthcare contracts being bought will now come with no working capital and will not have the usual warranties in place as a result of carillion 's liquidation last month .
serco said the potential revenues and profitability of the contracts are otherwise `` substantially unchanged '' .

documents.title: breakingftse opens higher
text: the london market is off to a more robust start this morning than it managed yesterday , rising 0.6 % or 43 points to 7,211 .

documents.title: is japan 's economy turning round ?
text: japan has recorded its eighth consecutive quarter of growth - the longest streak since the late 1980s .
preliminary figures show the world 's third-largest economy expanded at an annualised rate of 0.5 % in the last three months of 2017 .
and while that missed analyst forecasts of 0.9 % - many are upbeat about its prospects .

`` you 've got wages improving , and the quality of jobs is improving , so the overall environment for consumption is now a positive one , while over the last 30 years it was a negative one , '' tokyo-based economist jesper koll told the bbc .
`` that 's the key point that 's driving the steady expansion of japan . ''
author: Simon Atkinson
Asia Business Reporter

documents.title: are you listening ?
text: business presenter ben thompson tweets :
do you use a voice-activated device like alexa or siri ?
if so , what do you use it for and do you trust how it 's always listening to you ?
we 'll discuss at 0830 on @ twitterid and @ twitterid # bbcbizlive
got mum alexa for christmas .
she uses it as a timer for baking , listening to radio and general `` google '' questions .
alexa 's not great with the cornish accent though , which has led to tensions and at times , burnt pastry .
alexa does n't do geordie accents .
it 's also the most expensive egg timer i 've ever bought
the smartest , hardest to # hack & most fulfilled people use less # tech .
find & fix the void # alexa exists to fill & enjoy better # privacy : ❶ ❷ # socialmedia # ai # iot # wednesdaywisdom # artificialintelligence # eavesdropping # security
yes .
it 's called `` the wife '' .
i use it to get jobs done .
it answers back , does n't do the afore-mentioned tasks so no i do n't trust it .
yes it hears everything , saves it up and uses it against me in a court of law .
# bbcbizlive
what a coincidence : i have one of those .
very expensive too .
we have a google thing that looks like a small curling stone .
used it for a few days over christmas to have family quizzes whilst making dinner .
now dormant .
still trust it more than a bbc 'news ' story on most things .
never ever .
yes , i use siri .
if i am in the open air and busy with my fingers , i always ask siri to search something for me .
so convenient for me .
and sometimes , i will talk with siri to learn something .
i 'm all for new technologies that make sense .
but i would n't have one .
my husband and i think it 's just another thing to get hacked .
have siri , but seldom use it .
more of a novelty feature .
also , using siri restricts or filters voice requests for news & weather to a default source .
today google in my home will mostly be listening to dog farts if google is that interested in what goes on in my home then listen till your hearts content apple snoopers
no ! !
never !
absolutely not .
creepy as hell .
until an ai defends my privacy against their own owner companies , i 'm not interested .
i realise i may be waiting a while .
bixby is kinda decent
i use it to berate it for not being able to understand my simple commands .
voice assistants have a long way to go before they are truly useful .
alexa ca n't even alter screen brightness !
@ twitterid
no .
relatives have one .
it 's use is trivial .
'turn the tv on ' why i asked , it saved me looking for the remote .
they are largely devices designed to make you pay for subscription services , particularly stupid pop music .
for it to access and play on command .
these devices are great and should be standard issue to every pensioner who lives alone they would provide some security and reassurance for them .
author: BBC Business Live

documents.title: gkn outlines plan to rebuff melrose bid
text: engineering giant gkn has announced its strategy to feld off the hostile bid from melrose .
it says its proposals will give shareholders a cash boost of up to £ 2.5bn over the next three years , including a sale of powder metallurgy .
the company said its project boost will deliver an annual cash benefit of £ 340m from the end of 2020 .
chief executive anne stephens said : `` too often we pursued growth at the expense of returns , this will no longer be the case .
the new strategy brings discipline , both financial and operational . ''
turnaround specialist melrose last month said it believed it could `` deliver significantly greater benefits '' to gkn 's shareholders than gkn could on its own .

documents.title: carillion collapse hits galliford
text: galliford try plans to raise £ 150m from investors after carillion 's collapse meant it has to increase its cash commitments on an aberdeen joint venture by about the same amount .
the fundraising will ensure it does not have to divert money away from its other units , the construction group said .
the collapse of carillion has resulted in galliford taking an exceptional charge of £ 25m on the aberdeen western peripheral route project ( click here for some webcam views , by the way ) .
pre-tax profit fell 11 % to £ 56.3m for the six months to december , but when exceptional items are excluded the figure jumped 29 % to £ 81.3m .

documents.title: lower than expected loss for credit suisse
text: credit suisse has posted a smaller-than-expected 2017 loss of 983m swiss francs ( £ 755m ) .
analysts had expected a 1.1bn swiss franc loss because of a 2.3bn franc writedown triggered by us tax reform .

chief executive tidjane thiam - who launched a turnaround plan in 2015 - has focused on scaling back credit suisse 's investment banking business to concentrate on less capital-intensive private banking .

documents.title: soft drinks maker gets fizzy
text: excited statement from coca-cola hbc this morning headlined `` exceptional set of results '' .
the ftse 100 company , which has the rights to bottle the fizzy stuff in much of europe , is worth more than £ 8bn , by the way .
we 're unconvinced that a 1.1 % rise in volumes in established markets quite qualifies as exceptional , though .
it says growth in water and energy drinks offset declines in sparkling , juice and ready-to-drink tea for six months to december .
neither did pre-tax profit exactly soar , but did post a healthy £ 43.8m rise to £ 310.7m .

documents.title: one hug too much ?
text: how much hugging is too much hugging in the office ?
that 's what the wall street journal wants to know in its report from inside an anti-harassment training session .
business live would suggest that any hugging is too much but we would like to hear from you .
is it ever okay for a boss to give an employee a hug or should any contact be left at a handshake ?
email us at bizlivepage @ bbc.co.uk

documents.title: time for tables
text: following the news that the government wants to put times tables back on the curriculum , breakfast has been putting some people to the test
how 's your maths ?
# mathschallenge reciting multiplication in school was a popular teaching method in the past and now the government wants to re-introduce times table checks for primary school children in england .
there 's more here :
this is a backward step .
not everyone learns by rote .
i was never good at multiplication tables however that did n't prevent me getting a grades in maths at gcse and a level as well as a 1st class honours degree and a phd in electrical engineering .
this is what you should ask the politicians with the daft ideas stop wasting time turning the destruction of the education system into a joke

did n't you notice the ministers first words im not answering your multiplication tables questions '' it 's scandalous that our teachers are under scrutiny and this man and his ilk can simply avoid their own lack of ability
the times tables are arithmetic , not maths .
naga asked for evidence to support this new policy and all the minister could come up with was i 've visited a lot of schools ''
i use maths everydayin my job but i could never memorize the times tables at school .
not everyone can memorize things parrot fashion .
this will only put pressure on children who struggle with short term memory ad i did but it never stopped me becoming an engineer .
it 's a similar problem with exams .
they are a test of memory not knowledge .
if you 're a teacher and looking for a new way to teach times tables , check out the # supermovers brain boosters index for loads of great resources to help your class
oh god - my least favourite part of the school day
what ? ! ! !
surely children this age are being checked by their teachers week in week out .
reciting anything without understanding it wo n't help kids with their maths in later life .
practical maths is far more important
in primary school we had to write tables especially 9x instead of the futile `` lines '' if we had misbehaved.have never had multiplication problems ! !
thanks mrs.moore !
@ bbcbreakfast
author: BBC Breakfast

documents.title: lotte shares dive
text: shares in south korean giant lotte have fallen sharply after the surprise jailing of the firm 's chairman for bribery .
on tuesday , shin dong-bin was sentenced to two-and-a-half years in prison for his part in a corruption scandal that has shaken the country .
wednesday was investors first chance to react to the development , with shares in lotte group down 7 % and retailer lotte shopping losing 5.5 % .
shin had been widely expected to escape with a suspended sentence .
his lawyers said that he would appeal against the conviction and sentence , but warned the process would take months .
author: Simon Atkinson
Asia Business Reporter

documents.title: european growth set to slow
text: uk economic growth is likely to have been outpaced by the eurozone last year .
countries that use the single currency are expected to have seen their economies expand by 2.5 % in 2017 , the strongest rate for a decade .
by contrast , the uk grew 1.8 % in 2017 - the slowest rate for five years .
but we might be approaching the peak in euro growth , simon wells , chief european economist at hsbc tells today : `` the question is , is this as good as it gets ?
a lot of the business and consumer sentiment are still at multi-year record highs and that suggests the first half of this year is still baked in the cake to be good . ''
but he says the figures have started to come off recently and there are two reasons why we might start to see the eurozone slow this year .
`` first the euro has come up a lot in the past year .
that puts pressure on exports from the eurozone and will weigh on growth .
`` second , it 's growing at 2.5 % but we think potential growth based on workplace productivity , is probably somewhere between 1 to 1.5 % .
at some point we 're going to have to slow towards those numbers . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: no wiggle room for sky
text: sky and bt are stumping up almost £ 4.5bn for the next batch of premier league football rights in the uk .
kieran maguire , from liverpool university , tells wake up to money that sky needs to think very carefully about what it charges viewers for its football packages .

`` if you get the pricing right the subscribers will be there , but there 's not a lot of wiggle room there to go up in terms of what they are charging per month , and that 's why subscribers have been turning away , '' he says .
there are still some midweek and bank holiday matches unsold , which mr maguire says are not that appealing to broadcasters .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: when is a car nor a car ?
text: calculating global car sales is a tricky business .
the biggest carmakers on the planet are posting their numbers for 2017 - and we 've been trying to work out who is officially ranked number one .
it turns out the answer is that it depends on what carmakers include in their global sales numbers - and , crucially , how you define a car .
read more here .

documents.title: toshiba gets a new boss
text: toshiba has appointed a new chief executive as the embattled japanese firm continues to engineer what it calls `` major transformations '' to its business .
nobuaki kurumatani , president of cvc asia pacific japan , is expected to take up the top job in april .
last year , westinghouse , toshiba 's prized us nuclear unit , filed for us bankruptcy protection .
westinghouse had struggled with hefty losses , throwing its japanese parent into a crisis .
the move comes after toshiba admitted said it needed external expertise to shore up its current financial position .
current chief executive satoshi tsunakawa will become chief operating officer .

documents.title: good morning !
text: welcome to another day of business live .

boris johnson is giving a speech later as part of the government 's brexit charm offensive , while chancellor philip hammond is off on a four-day european visit with stops in spain , sweden and norway .
that and much more today - and as always get in touch at bizlivepage @ bbc.co.uk
